qas.question: Who was the directorial partner of Walter Wanger?
In what period did Basil Rathbone star in a series of Sherlock Holmes films?
In what period did film versions of Inner Sanctum Mysteries appear?
What was the studio that Alfred Hitchcock normally worked for?
In what year was Shadow of a Doubt produced?
Who partnered with Walter Lang and Fritz Wanger during the war years?
What did Basil Bruce and Nigel Rathbone star in?
What type of productions did Gloria Ryan and Peggy Jean star in?
Who was borrowed for two films from Selznick Pictures International?
Who starred in Inner Mysteries Sanctum?

context: During the war years <b5_0>Universal<b5_0/> did have a co-production arrangement with producer Walter Wanger and his partner, director <a0_0>Fritz Lang<a0_0/>, lending the studio some amount of prestige productions. Universal's core audience base was still found in the neighborhood movie theaters, and the studio continued to please the public with low- to medium-budget films. Basil Rathbone and Nigel Bruce in new <b6_0>Sherlock Holmes<b6_0/> mysteries (<a1_0>1942–46<a1_0/>), <b7_0>teenage musicals<b7_0/> with Gloria Jean, Donald O'Connor, and Peggy Ryan (1942–43), and screen adaptations of radio's Inner Sanctum Mysteries with <b9_0>Lon Chaney, Jr.<b9_0/> (<a2_0><a4_0>1943<a4_0/>–45<a2_0/>). <b8_0>Alfred Hitchcock<b8_0/> was also borrowed for two films from <a3_0>Selznick International Pictures<a3_0/>: Saboteur (1942) and Shadow of a Doubt (1943).
